sentences.english: When he turned back, the burglar was surprised that his coat was missing. So he groped around for it.

sentences.english: They left Ezion Geber and camped at Kadesh, in the Desert of Zin.

sentences.english: If we lose the human side of our world, in the end, we still have to find Shangrila and bring.

sentences.english: So they went up, and searched the land from the wilderness of Zin unto Rehob, as men come to Hamath.

definition: to look for/to seek/to find fault
to make one's home/to take shelter
to find out/to search out/to uncover/to discover
to find (sth one has been looking for)
quiet, silent, and lonely/far and indistinct/gone without a trace
deep and somber/see also 窈窈[yao3 yao3]
to find a place where one can fit in/to make one's home/to seek shelter
to search for the right word (of poet)
